intro: Cyrtosia minahassae, commonly known as the Minahassa cyrtosia, is a tropical plant native to Indonesia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers with red veins. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
